issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
My thoughts:

> Bringing this back to ROS; jade selected gazebo5 and therefore we shouldn't expect to use gazebo6 with jade. However, a person is free to compile from source.

I agree. The agreement between the Gazebo team and the ROS team affects only to ros_gazebo_pkgs of the gazebo version selected by ROS distribution (gazebo5 in this case). Nothing to do with gazebo6.

>  We have gone down the road of releasing gazebo6 debians for jade, so we should make it work.

They really can work no matter the ogre version in gazebo, the problem is to install RVIZ with ros_gazebo6_pkgs.

> This is something that should not be done since it could make another end user very unhappy (for example, an end user that installs gazebo6 on trusty and writes a plugin that needs libogre-1.9)

That is completely a valid reasoning. And probably the right to do after releasing the first gazebo6 using ogre-1.9. The change was motivated by the assumption of there are a good bunch of users that would benefit of it (ROS/Jade and ROS/Indigo + Gazebo6) vs a probably a little part of them (Gazebo + ogre-1.9 which use 1.9 features) that will suffer the consequences. Bug again, does not fully justify the change once released.
